content: by alexis cole acole129@gmail com twisted ear warmer skill level advanced beginner this twisted ear warmer is quick easy and giftable it s also cute and comfy to wear pattern essentials tools & materials stitch abbreviations 72 yards 46 grams of any bulky weight 5 yarn chain chain 6 5mm crochet hook or size to obtain gauge half_double_crochet half_double_crochet yarn needle slip_stitch slip_stitch scissors notes gauge 7 sts x 5 row = 2 in half_double_crochet finished size 22 in length before joining for twist 4 in width time to complete 40 minutes  use this pattern in any way you like please just credit me for the design  this project is worked in row not in the round  stitch counts are included in parenthesis at the end of each row  the two turning chains at the beginning of each row do not count as a stitch  the finished product is intended to fit the average adult but the size is easily adjusted by adding or subtracting foundation chain and half_double_crochet row ~ 1 ~ special stitches when viewed from the top each half_double_crochet appears to have three loops in this pattern the loops are referenced by their position in relation to you as you work back loop front loop pattern instructions cast on leaving about an 8 tail used for sewing later chain 64 row 1 half_double_crochet in the 2nd chain from the hook and half_double_crochet across 63 chain 2 then turn row 2 half_double_crochet in back loop only across 63 chain 2 then turn row 3 half_double_crochet in front loop only across 63 chain 2 then turn row 4-7 repeat row 2 and 3 63 row 8 half_double_crochet in back loop only across 63 fasten_off and cut the yarn row 9 cast on and slip_stitch across starting from the opposite end of the rectangle so this row is worked in the same direction as row 8 63 fasten_off and cut yarn note this row ensures that both long sides of your rectangle are symmetrical ~ 2 ~ finishing weave in all ends except for the 8 tail from the foundation chains note the ends will be well- hidden in the finished product if woven in along the short edges of the rectangle to create the twist first identify the right side of your rectangle photo 1 fold the rectangle in half along its length with the right sides of the rectangle together photo 2 tuck each folded short end into the other so where they join alternates between sides photo 3 using the 8 tail and a yarn needle whip stitch all four layers of the folded short ends together be careful to sew through all four layers turn the ear warmer right-side out and viola there s the twist fasten_off cut the yarn and weave in the end photo 1 photo 2 photo 3 ~ 3 ~
